title: What would the Naruto series be like if Naruto and Hinata were the same age as Neji, Lee and Tenten instead of the Rookie Nine? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let’s see, Team 7 wouldn’t be the same. (They’d probably have some irrelevant character take Naruto’s place). The friendship between Naruto and Sasuke wouldn’t exist, and Sakura and Sasuke wouldn’t become all that close as they were in Part 1. Kakashi probably wouldn’t even like the Team and they’d probably fail the bell test (hypothetically speaking). Team 8 wouldn’t be the same and some irrelevant girl would take Hinata’s place. That doesn’t really matter since we don’t see much of Team 8, they’ll just become more transparent. Sasuke would get the curse mark and leave the first chance he gets with no regrets, and since Naruto doesn’t really about Sasuke all that much they wouldn’t try to retrieve him :/ Sakura wouldn’t find the motivation to get stronger and would probably wallow in her misery. Since Sasuke ignores her and hasn’t taught her the true meaning of loneliness, she might fall out of love with him. If Sakura doesn’t get the motivation to become stronger, Kankuro, Chiyo, Gaara and everyone else she’s healed will die. This might not happen if Ino snaps Sakura out of her funk and the two train under Tsunade. Besides that, if Sakura does continue to love him, she’ll probably be killed around the time after he kills Danzo. He’d probably kill Karin at that time too. There would be no one to save Sasuke from darkness and Kakashi would end up killing him or being killed by him. Sasuke cannot be dragged out of darkness and continues his path. Heck he might even team up with Obito and Madara. Naruto and Hinata on the other hand, might get put on the same team with some other irrelevant character. The problem is Naruto wouldn’t get his character development provided by Sakura and Sasuke so he wouldn’t be as strong as he is. He would be friends with Lee since the two are made fun of as dead lasts. Also, his team wouldn’t face any opponents like Zabuza and Haku; meaning no character development. He also won’t face Orochimaru. Now, Naruto’s sensei could be one of the adults who hates him, putting him down constantly. And the other irrelevant teammate of Naruto’s would do the same probably. Naruto wouldn’t get any motivation unless he meets Jiraiya and the two go find Tsunade. If that happens, then Naruto is on the right path. He leaves Konoha with Jiraiya and everything would probably be the same for Hinata’s storyline.

They’d be sorted into different teams, so it’d probably be very different. I don’t know who all they’d be sorted with, but I suppose there’s a chance it’d be Neji, at the top of the class, Naruto at the bottom, and maybe Hinata or Tenten as the third member, as they both seem average. Naruto and Hinata might get together sooner, as Hinata would probably gain more confidence sooner, and Naruto’s rivalry would probably be with Neji. I don’t think Neji would ever go dark, but he and Naruto would probably become great rivals and be close. They’d help each other, though I don’t think Naruto would be as strong.
